newsitem.title: ISRAEL: India to buy two fast-attack boats from Israel.
newsitem.headline: India to buy two fast-attack boats from Israel.

text.p: The Indian Navy has ordered two extra-fast attacks boats from a division of Israel Aircraft Industries (IAI) and India's Goa Shipyard Ltd., IAI said on Monday.

Nathan Galili, general manager of IAI'S Ramta division, which made the sale, would not disclose the value of the contract but told Reuters: "It is reasonable to assume that this marks a breakthrough in a new and big market."

The order, for delivery in 18 months' time, is for Ramta's Super Dvora MK II, a fast-attack craft of 50 tons displacement designed for coastal surveillance and reconnaissance and for commando operations. The vessel is equipped with sophisticated weapons and surveillance systems, Ramta said.

Galili said the contract was the first ever awarded to Ramta by the Indian government and would probably lead to additional purchases by the Indian navy and coast guard. The Super Dvora MK II is already in service in the Israeli and five other navies.
